meanings.definition: A pin passed through the end of an axle to keep a wheel in position.
meanings.sent1: The lynchpin held the wheel securely in place.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the lynchpin regularly to prevent any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the lynchpin was a shiny acorn.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the lynchpin of the plot was the mysterious letter.
meanings.sent5: Without the lynchpin, the wheel would wobble dangerously.

meanings.definition: A person or thing vital to an organization or plan.
meanings.sent1: She was the lynchpin of the team, always keeping everyone motivated.
meanings.sent2: Communication is the lynchpin of any successful project.
meanings.sent3: The coffee machine, the true lynchpin of the office, finally broke down.
meanings.sent4: His innovative idea became the lynchpin that held the entire campaign together.
meanings.sent5: The lynchpin of the event was the surprise guest, creating excitement for all attendees.
